overview:
Carl Anderson joined Glynn Capital in 2008 and focuses primarily on the firm’s investment portfolio in public companies. He is responsible for portfolio management, company analysis, due diligence and identifying new investment opportunities. In addition, Carl’s experience as an investor and entrepreneur also provide valuable insights into both current and future venture investments.

From 2001-2008, Carl was a Partner at Stonebrook Fund Management, a long/short equity hedge fund in New York City. At Stonebrook, Carl was responsible for global technology, media, telecom and consumer investments. From 1999-2001, Carl served in various management roles at AllAdvantage.com, a venture-backed company he co-founded while at Stanford Business School. From 1995-1997, Carl was an Analyst at Gleacher & Co. in New York City.

Carl received an MBA from Stanford University Graduate School of Business in 1999 and a BA in Economics from Princeton University in 1995.
